param.name: args.css.output.dir
param.desc: Specifies the directory to put CSS files into for EPUB and Kindle transforms. By default it is the configured topic output directory.

param.name: cover.graphic.file
param.desc: Specifies the absolute or relative path of the graphic to use as the cover graphic for the EPUB. An absolute, platform-specific filename or a path relative to the root map to a JPG, PNG, or GIF to use as the cover graphic.

param.name: d4p.max.nav.depth
param.desc: Specifies the maximum depth of the navigation table of contents. The default is the value of the d4p.max.toc.depth parameter, which itself defaults to "5".

param.name: d4p.max.toc.depth
param.desc: Specifies the maximum depth of the generated HTML table of contents.

param.name: topics.output.dir
param.desc: Specifies the name of the directory within the EPUB to hold all the topics.

param.name: epub.exclude.auto.rellinks
param.desc: Turns on exclusion of auto-generated related links (as for normal HTML output) Controls base Toolkit processing by turning off the maplink-check and maplink targets, which has the effect of eliminating auto-generated related links. Note that explicitly-authored related links are not affected. This property cannot be set to true by default because it is a global property that affects all transformation types. You must set this property explicitly in order to suppress related links in the output.

param.name: epub.pubid.uri.stub
param.desc: Specifies the URI prefix stub to use in constructing the full EPUB ID value in the EPUB metadata. Any valid URI string. If this is a relative URI it should end with a "/" character. This parameter should normally reflect the organization that owns or publishes the EPUB, e.g., "http://mydomain.com/EPUB" or something similar.

param.name: epub.temp.dir
param.desc: Specifies the directory to use for EPUB-specific processing separate from the main Toolkit"s temp directory. An absolute platform-specific filename. This directory holds all the files that are then Zipped up to create the final EPUB file. By default temporary EPUB files are stored in a directory called "epub_temp" within the defined Toolkit temp directory.

param.name: images.output.dir
param.desc: Specifies the name of the directory within the EPUB to hold all images. Any valid directory name. The EPUB process automatically renames graphics to ensure that there are no name conflicts when the graphics are copied to into this directory from their source locations.
